required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: To Compare Efficacy and Safety Between CT-P10 and Rituxan in Patients With Low Tumour Burden Follicular Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Randomised, Parallel-group, Active-controlled, Double-blind Study to Compare Efficacy and Safety Between CT-P10 and Rituxan in Patients With Low Tumour Burden Follicular Lymphoma

brief_summary.textblock: To demonstrate that CT-P10 is similar to Rituxan in terms of efficacy as determined by overall response rate at 7 months

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Primary Efficacy Endpoint - Overall Response Rate by 7 Months
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the Month 7 (up to Maintenance Cycle 3; Week 28)
primary_outcome.description: ORR was defined as the proportion of patients with the best response of complete response (CR), unconfirmed CR (CRu), or partial response (PR) by central review. Per 1999 IWG criteria, the disease status was assessed by using contrasted CT and/or MRI, and CR, CRu, and PR were defined as followings; CR=Disappearance of all clinical/radiographic evidence of disease: regression of lymph nodes to normal size, absence of B-symptoms, bone marrow involvement, and organomegaly, and normal LDH level; CRu=Regression of measurable disease: >75% decrease in SPD of target lesions and in each target lesions. no increase in the size of non-target lesions, neither new lesion nor organomegaly measured; PR=Regression of measurable disease: ≥50% decrease in SPD of target lesions and no evidence of disease progression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Efficacy Endpoint - ORR Over the Study Period
secondary_outcome.description: ORR was defined as the proportion of patients with the best response of complete response (CR), unconfirmed CR (CRu), or partial response (PR). Per 1999 IWG criteria, the disease status was assessed by using contrasted CT and/or MRI, and CR, CRu, and PR were defined as followings; CR=Disappearance of all clinical/radiographic evidence of disease: regression of lymph nodes to normal size, absence of B-symptoms, bone marrow involvement, and organomegaly, and normal LDH level; CRu=Regression of measurable disease: >75% decrease in SPD of target lesions and in each target lesions. no increase in the size of non-target lesions, neither new lesion nor organomegaly measured; PR=Regression of measurable disease: ≥50% decrease in SPD of target lesions and no evidence of disease progression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary PD Endpoint - B-cell Kinetics (B-cell Depletion and Recovery)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Induction Cycle 1 (predose, 1 hr postdose), Induction Cycle 2 to 4 (predose), EOT1/EOT2 (anytime), Maintenance Cycle 1 to 2 (predose, 1hr postdose) and Maintenance Cycle 3 (predose).
secondary_outcome.description: B-cell kinetics were demonstrated by median values of B-cell counts. Any values below the LLoQ were set as LLoQ which was 20 cells/μL.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1, 2, 3, 4, 12, 20 weeks (predose, 1 hr post dose), EOT1/EOT2 (anytime during the day) and 28 week (predose)
1, 2, 3, 4, 12, 20 weeks (predose, 1 hr post dose), EOT1/EOT2 (anytime during the day) and 28 week (predose)
Overall study period (Baseline, Month 3, 7, 13, 19 27, and every 6 months thereafter).
secondary_outcome.description: PFS was defined as the interval between randomization and disease progression/relapse by IWG 1999 (at least a 50% increase of any single nodal after smallest decrease) or death from any cause, whichever occurred first. Locally reviewed data was used for the secondary efficacy analyses.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Overall study period (median follow-up of 29.2 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival was defined as the interval between randomization and death from any cause. Locally reviewed data was used for the secondary efficacy analyses.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Overall study period (Baseline, Month 3, 7, 13, 19 27, and every 6 months thereafter).
secondary_outcome.description: Time to progression was defined as the interval between randomization and disease progression/relapse by IWG 1999 (at least a 50% increase of any single nodal after smallest decrease) or death as a result of lymphoma, whichever occurred first. Locally reviewed data was used for the secondary efficacy analyses.

arm_group.description: CT-P10, intervention 375mg/m2, intravenous, 4 cycles in induction period and additional 12 cycles in maintenance period
Rituxan, 375mg/m2 intravenous, 4 cycles in induction period, Rituxan for the first 6 cycles and CT-P10 for the last 6 cycles in maintenance period.

intervention.description: 375mg/m2, IV on day1 of 4 cycles in induction period, and 12 cycles in maintenance period.
375mg/m2, IV on day1 of 4 cycles in induction period, Rituxan for the first 6 cycles and CT-P10 for the last 6 cycles in maintenance period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Confirmed diagnosis of low tumour burden, CD20+ follicular lymphoma
- Ann Arbor Stage II, III or IV
Exclusion Criteria:
- Has receive rituximab
- Allergies or hypersensitivity to murine, chimeric, human or humanised proteins
- Previous treatment for NHL
- Any malignancy
- Current or recent treatment with any other investigational medicinal product or device
- pregnant or lactating

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 402 participants were screened for the study. Of those, 144 participants failed screening and 258 participants were enrolled in the study.

group.title: CT-P10
group.description: CT-P10 375mg/m2, IV, 4 cycles in induction period and additional 12 cycles in maintenance period

group.title: Rituxan
group.description: Rituxan, 375mg/m2, IV, 4 cycles in induction period, Rituxan for the first 6 cycles and CT-P10 for the last 6 cycles in maintenance period.

participants_list.participants: Five subjects completed the induction period but did not initiate this period in the CT-P10 group.
Eight subjects completed the induction period but did not initiate this period in the Rituxan group.
One subject completed the MP1 but did not initiate this period in the CT-P10 group.
Two subjects completed the MP1 but did not initiate this period in the Rituxan group.

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Primary Efficacy Endpoint - Overall Response Rate by 7 Months
outcome.description: ORR was defined as the proportion of patients with the best response of complete response (CR), unconfirmed CR (CRu), or partial response (PR) by central review. Per 1999 IWG criteria, the disease status was assessed by using contrasted CT and/or MRI, and CR, CRu, and PR were defined as followings; CR=Disappearance of all clinical/radiographic evidence of disease: regression of lymph nodes to normal size, absence of B-symptoms, bone marrow involvement, and organomegaly, and normal LDH level; CRu=Regression of measurable disease: >75% decrease in SPD of target lesions and in each target lesions. no increase in the size of non-target lesions, neither new lesion nor organomegaly measured; PR=Regression of measurable disease: ≥50% decrease in SPD of target lesions and no evidence of disease progression.
outcome.time_frame: During the Month 7 (up to Maintenance Cycle 3; Week 28)
outcome.population: The ITT population consisted of all patients enrolled and randomly assigned to receive a study drug, regardless of whether or not any study drug dosing was completed.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The equivalence margin of ±17% was predefined.

outcome.description: B-cell kinetics were demonstrated by median values of B-cell counts. Any values below the LLoQ were set as LLoQ which was 20 cells/μL.

outcome.population: The PD population consisted of all patients who received at least 1 dose (full) of study drug and had at least 1 posttreatment PD result.

outcome.description: PFS was defined as the interval between randomization and disease progression/relapse by IWG 1999 (at least a 50% increase of any single nodal after smallest decrease) or death from any cause, whichever occurred first. Locally reviewed data was used for the secondary efficacy analyses.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events (AEs) and Serious adverse events (SAEs) were to be collected from the date the ICF was signed until up to 30 days from the last dose of the study drug, regardless of the relationship to the study drug. data from the overall study period (median follow-up of 29.2 months) are presented.

group.title: CT-P10
group.description: CT-P10 375mg/m2, IV, 4 cycles in induction period and additional 12 cycles in maintenance period

group.title: Rituxan
group.description: Rituxan, 375mg/m2, IV, 4 cycles in induction period, Rituxan for the first 6 cycles and CT-P10 for the last 6 cycles in maintenance period.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A confidentiality and non-disclosure agreement (CDA) was executed between Celltrion, Inc. and some PIs who have participated in publications funded by the sponsor for academic purposes for a period that is more than 180 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: In this study, TTE endpoints were secondary endpoints and were not powered. As medians of PFS, TTP, and OS were not reached in both treatment groups, longer follow-up is needed to ascertain the median time for TTE parameters of PFS, TTP, and OS.
